document_title: Brugada syndrome: Causes, diagnosis and treatment
subsection_content: If you are diagnosed with Brugada syndrome, have a history of dangerous ventricular arrhythmias, a history of cardiac arrest that has been resuscitated, or an electrophysiological examination notes a dangerous arrhythmia, the disease is considered to be at risk of sudden death. High. At this time, your doctor may recommend an implantable cardioverter defibrillator (ICD) to prevent sudden death. To date, only ICD implantation is the most effective method to prevent sudden arrhythmic death in patients with Brugada syndrome.
